pros: accessibility, flexible, kind, caring, understanding
cons: lack of communication, not always clear on instructions for the job.

pros: good benefits for salary and hourly workers
cons: Poor management. Hostile work environment

pros: Good benefits and work-life balance.
cons: Administration and blatant cronyism. Also, high-turnover and below-market pay.

pros: Flexible working hours for tutors, friendly co-wokers and pleasant boss.
cons: None - I loved working there

review_title: Okay for a while but start looking for something better eventually
pros: Mostly pleasant people to work with and I enjoyed the work because I was able to use my key skills and experience. Plus I was able to make significant contributions to my department's growth and success.
cons: Salary was barely adequate, and I clashed with one coworker who was able to curry favor with the management.  I accumulated reprimands for petty infractions that I thought could have been overlooked by a more understanding manager.

review_title: All in all, working at Southwest Tennessee Community College, has been a very positive experience.
job_title: Senior Lab Technician in Memphis, TN
pros: Great health benefits, generally the people that we work with are pretty good joes. Good family support if you or your spouse, kids etc. have any problems.
cons: Saleries are pretty low, compared to the average pay for someone with my 31 years of computer/network/database manager experience.

review_title: Forward Thinking Staff Crippled by Obstinate Management
pros: Some of the best faculty and staff work at Southwest and truly care about student welfare. Some departments are pushing technology and learning to keep up with current education practices. Health benefits, retirement, and continuing education for staff are great.
cons: College always seemed mired with financial woes and mulish upper-management that have been clinging on to their jobs for far too long. A change of the old guard to allow new ideas and leadership in various departments would serve the college well.

review_title: Challenging and rewarding at the same time
pros: Opportunities to shine abound.  New executive management seems well suited to face challenges head on.  Very liberal vacation policy.  Great education benefits.
cons: Too much nepotism.  Lack of accountability is rampant.  Departmental structure seems odd to me.  Communication is lacking.  Clunky response to the needs of the community.

pros: The people we work with are very friendly and kind. Most people on the instructor/professor level get along well with each other.
cons: We are the lowest paid instructors in all the Tennessee Board of Regents domain. When you add grading hours, committees, conferences and office hours we hardly make enough to make ends meet.

review_title: Great Job Satisfaction with Poor Salary!
pros: 9-Month Work, 3-Month Vacation; Extra pay (1/32 of your Salary for 1 Credit Hour) for Summer Teaching; Great Health, Dental, Vision Benefit; Good Retirement Plan, 401 (K); Tuition Reimbursement + PC-191 Benefit to take 9 credit hours classes for 4 Semesters a year; Half Day of Work Load (Not a 9-5 job)!
cons: Poor Salary; Long Time to increase Salary; Patience to teach Poor Students!

pros: Relaxed working conditions, Good co workers, Able to really assist people, great benefits including college tuition discount at any TBR School.
cons: Office Politics, there is a constant struggle for influence among managers, Low pay, the ability of someone who has influence but no knowledge of your department to make major decisions affecting the entire dept and it's ability to provide service.

review_title: undergraduate/Hospitality Management in the concentration of Culinary Arts.
job_title: Undergraduate Hospitality Management C/O Culinary Arts in Memphis, TN
pros: The only Institution in the Mid-South that has three course of Majors in the Hospitality Management. Got a great deal of hands on training under Head Culinary Instructor doing Charity events. 10 in all total of my volunteering my time.
cons: Wish the institution has more to offer when it comes to culinary arts.

pros: Southwest truly is committed to student success. The benefits are VERY generous.
cons: Different departments rarely help each other out. I've been outright ignored by IT and Physical Plant. People who have been there 20+ years tend to be territorial and nasty. Their technological infrastructure is atrocious.

job_title: Instructor/Academic Computing Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: Offers services to the community service, offers opportunity to the challenged, relatively low tuition cost
cons: A very political environment, most positions are underpaid, many of the students are unprepared for college upon admission

review_title: Great student job for Paralegal Studies majors only.
job_title: Paralegal Studies Computer Lab Technician in Memphis, TN
pros: This is a great position as a student because you meet so many fellow students and faculty in your major and you have down time to complete your homework with every resource readily available.
cons: It is necessary to work Saturdays.

pros: The annual and sick leave with pay is excellent.  Freedom to do your job.  Tuition reimbursement is nice.
cons: Communication at t his company is ok.

review_title: I enjoy helping the students and getting to know some of my coworkers

cons: Current office politics are a distraction and are creating a tense environment

pros: Flexible, very helpful administration and hands on.
cons: There are not too many negatives for this company. I feel that the program could have continued with a larger grant.

pros: Great college, helpful co-workers, great students, great work environment!
cons: Teaching assignments too short, and department chairs unaware of situation

cons: Salaries on the low end but really enjoy coming to work.

review_title: This should be your last resort
job_title: Account Clerk II in Memphis, TN

cons: Leadership is mediocre at best.  Workers are highly resistant to change.  If you plan on thinking this is not the place for you.
